description: An illustration of a blue flag pole with two windsocks attached to it: at the top is a windsock consisting of five differently-colored streamers (the colors at the base of the windsock are - from top to bottom - dark blue, red, blue, teal, and yellow; the colors of the streamers from top to bottom are teal, blue, yellow, dark blue, and red) and below that is a carp-shaped windsock, also known as a koinobori. Koinobori are flown in Japan, traditionally for the holiday known as Children's Day.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
